descr.p: TheRegistration Instructionsmessage type may be used by institutions or retail intermediaries wishing to electronically submit registration information to a broker or fund manager (for CIV) for an order or for an allocation.

ARegistration Instructionsmessage can be submitted as new, cancel or replace. TheRegistTransTypefield indicates the purpose of the message. When submitting replace or cancelRegistTransTypemessages theRegistRefIDfield is required. ReplacementRegistration Instructionsmessages must contain all data for the replacement registration.
See VOLUME 7 - "PRODUCT: COLLECTIVE INVESTMENT VEHICLES"

TheRegistration Instructionsmessage contains repeating fields for each of several joint registrants. The number of registration details instances is indicated in NoRegistDtls. The repeating fields are shown in the message definition below in typeface Bold-Italic and indented with the symbol. The fields relative position within the repeating group in the message is important. For example, each instance of registration must be in the order as shown in the message definition below.

field.name: RegistID
field.comment: Unique identifier of the originalRegistration Instructionsdetails

field.name: RegistTransType
field.comment: Identifies originalRegistration Instructionstransaction type

field.name: RegistRefID
field.comment: Required for Cancel and ReplaceRegistTransTypemessages

field.name: ClOrdID
field.comment: Unique identifier of the order as assigned by institution or intermediary.

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Parties" (firm identification) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".

descr.p: TheRegistration Instructions Responsemessage type may be used by broker or fund manager (for CIV) in response to aRegistration Instructionsmessage submitted by an institution or retail intermediary for an order or for an allocation.
TheRegistration Instructions Responsemessage is used to:

ol.li: confirm the receipt of aRegistration Instructionsmessage
confirm changes to an existingRegistration Instructionsmessage (i.e. accept cancel and replace requests)
relay assigned client and account Ids forRegistration Instructionsmessages withRegistTransType=New

descr.p:
EachRegistration Instructions Responsemessage contains aRegistStatusfield which is used to communicate the current state of theRegistration Instructionsas understood by the broker or fund manager. The Registration Instruction statuses are as follows (in highest to lowest precedence):
RegistStatus
Description
Accepted Registration details are acceptable to the receiving broker, intermediary or fund manager. Assigned client and account Ids may be returned.
Rejected Registration details have been rejected by the receiving broker, intermediary or fund manager.
Held Registration details have been held by the receving broker, intermediary or fund manager. Assigned (possibly provisional) client and account Ids may be returned.

descr.p: The order mass cancel request message requests the cancelation of all of the remaining quantity of a group of orders matching criteria specified within the request. NOTE: This message can only be used to cancel order messages (reduce the full quantity).

An order mass cancel request is assigned aClOrdIDand is treated as a separate entity. The order mass cancel request is acknowledged using an Order Mass Cancel Report. TheOrder Mass Cancel Reportwill contain theClOrdIDthat was specified on the Order Mass Cancel Request. TheClOrdIDassigned to the cancel request must be unique amongst theClOrdIDassigned to regular orders, replacement orders, cancel requests, and order mass cancel requests.

An immediate response to this message is required. It is recommended that an ExecutionRpt with ExecType=Pending Cancel be sent unless theOrder Mass Cancel Requestcan be immediately accepted (ExecutionRpt with ExecType=Canceled) or rejected (Order Cancel Reject message).

field.name: ClOrdID
field.comment: ClOrdID provided on the Order Mass Cancel Request.

field.name: OrderID
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX 5.0 SP1).Unique Identifier for theOrder Mass Cancel Requestassigned by the recipient of the Order Mass Cancel Request

field.name: MassActionReportID
field.comment: Unique Identifier for the Order Mass Cancel Report assigned by the recipient of the Order Mass Cancel Request

field.name: SecondaryOrderID
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX 5.0 SP1).Secondary Order ID assigned by the recipient of the Order Mass Cancel Request

field.name: MassCancelRequestType
field.comment: Order Mass Cancel Request Type accepted by the system

field.name: MassCancelResponse
field.comment: Indicates the action taken by the counterparty order handling system as a result of the Cancel Request 0 - IndicatesOrder Mass Cancel Requestwas rejected.

field.name: MassCancelRejectReason
field.comment: Indicates whyOrder Mass Cancel Requestwas rejected Required ifMassCancelResponse= 0

field.name: TotalAffectedOrders
field.comment: Optional field used to indicate the total number of orders affected by the Order Mass Cancel Request.

field.name: NoAffectedOrders
field.comment: Optional field used to indicate the number of order identifiers for orders affected by the Order Mass Cancel Request. Must be followed withOrigClOrdIDas the next field

field.name: OrigClOrdID
field.comment: Required ifNoAffectedOrders> 0. Indicates the client order id of an order affected by the Order Mass Cancel Request.

field.name: AffectedOrderID
field.comment: Contains theOrderIDassigned by the counterparty of an affected order. Not required as part of the repeating group.

field.name: AffectedSecondaryOrderID
field.comment: Contains theSecondaryOrderIDassigned by the counterparty of an affected order. Not required as part of the repeating group

field.name: NoNotAffectedOrders
field.comment: Optional field used to indicate the number of order identifiers for orders not affected by the request. Must be followed with NotAffOrigClOrdID(1372) as the next field.

field.name: NotAffOrigClOrdID
field.comment: Required if NoNotAffectedOrders(1370) > 0 and must be the first repeating field in the group. Indicates the client order id of an order not affected by the request. If order(s) were manually delivered (or otherwise not delivered over FIX and not assigned a ClOrdID) this field should contain string "MANUAL".

field.name: NotAffectedOrderID
field.comment: Contains the OrderID assigned by the counterparty of an unaffected order. Not required as part of the repeating group if NotAffOrigClOrdID(1372) has a value other than "MANUAL".

field.name: TradingSessionID
field.comment: Trading Session in which orders are to be canceled

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Stipulations" (repeating group of Fixed Income stipulations) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".

field.name: Price
field.comment: Required for limit OrdTypes. For F/X orders, should be the "all-in" rate (spot rate adjusted for forward points). Can be used to specify a limit price for a pegged order, previously indicated, etc.

field.name: StopPx
field.comment: Required forOrdType= "Stop" orOrdType= "Stop limit".

block.comment: Insert here the set of "TriggeringInstruction" fields defined in "common components of application messages".
Insert here the set of "SpreadOrBenchmarkCurveData" (Fixed Income spread or benchmark curve) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".
Insert here the set of "YieldData" (yield-related) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".

field.name: IOIID
field.comment: Required for Previously Indicated Orders (OrdType=E)

field.name: QuoteID
field.comment: Required for Previously Quoted Orders (OrdType=D)

field.name: TimeInForce
field.comment: Absence of this field indicates Day order

field.name: EffectiveTime
field.comment: Can specify the time at which the order should be considered valid

field.name: ExpireDate
field.comment: Conditionally required ifTimeInForce= GTD andExpireTimeis not specified.

field.name: ExpireTime
field.comment: Conditionally required ifTimeInForce= GTD andExpireDateis not specified.

field.name: GTBookingInst
field.comment: States whether executions are booked out or accumulated on a partially filled GT order

field.name: MaxShow
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)

block.comment: Insert here the set of "PegInstruction" fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".
Insert here the set of "DiscretionInstruction" fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".

field.name: TargetStrategy
field.comment: The target strategy of the order

field.name: NoStrategyParameters
field.comment: Indicates number of strategy parameters

field.name: StrategyParameterName
field.comment: Name of parameter

field.name: StrategyParameterType
field.comment: Datatype of the parameter.

field.name: StrategyParameterValue
field.comment: Value of the parameter

field.name: TargetStrategyParameters
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)For further specification of the TargetStrategy

field.name: ParticipationRate
field.comment: (Deprecated in FIX.5.0)Mandatory for a TargetStrategy=Participate order and specifies the target particpation rate. For other order types optionally specifies a volume limit (i.e. do not be more than this percent of the market volume)

field.name: CancellationRights
field.comment: For CIV - Optional

field.name: RegistID
field.comment: Reference toRegistration Instructionsmessage for this Order.

field.name: Designation
field.comment: Supplementary registration information for this Order

descr.p: Used to modify a cross order previously submitted using theNew Order - Crossmessage. See Order Cancel Replace Request for details concerning message usage.
Refer to the Order Cancel Replace Request message for restrictions on what fields can be changed during a cancel replace.
The Cross Order-specific fields,CrossType(tag 549) andCrossPrioritization(tag 550), can not be modified using the Cross Order Cancel Replace Request.

field.name: OrderID
field.comment: Unique identifier of most recent order as assigned by sell-side (broker, exchange, ECN).

field.name: CrossID
field.comment: CrossID for the replacement order

field.name: OrigCrossID
field.comment: Must match theCrossIDof previous cross order. Same order chaining mechanism as ClOrdID/OrigClOrdID with single order Cancel/Replace.

field.name: HostCrossID
field.comment: Host assigned entity ID that can be used to reference all components of a cross; sides + strategy + legs.

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Root Parties" fields defined in "common components of application messages" Used for acting parties that applies to the whole message, not individual sides.

field.name: NoSides
field.comment: Must be 1 or 2

field.name: ClOrdID
field.comment: Unique identifier of the order as assigned by institution or by the intermediary with closest association with the investor.

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Parties" (firm identification) fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".
Insert here the set of "OrderQtyData" fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".

field.comment: Must be set ifEncodedTextfield is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of theTextfield in the encoded format specified via theMessageEncodingfield.

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Instrument" fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".

field.name: NoUnderlyings
field.comment: Number of underlyings

block.comment: Must be provided if Number of underlyings > 0

field.name: NoLegs
field.comment: Number of legs Identifies a Multi-leg Execution if present and non-zero.

block.comment: Must be provided if Number of legs > 0

field.name: TransactTime
field.comment: Time this order request was initiated/released by the trader, trading system, or intermediary.

descr.p: Used to fully cancel the remaining open quantity of a cross order.

field.name: Text
field.comment: Comment, instructions, or other identifying information.

field.name: MarketID
field.comment: Optional MarketID to specify a particular trading session for which you want to obtain a list of securities that are tradeable.

field.name: MarketSegmentID
field.comment: Optional Market Segment Identifier to specify a particular trading session for which you want to obtain a list of securities that are tradeable.

field.name: TradingSessionID
field.comment: Optional Trading Session Identifier to specify a particular trading session for which you want to obtain a list of securities that are tradeable.

field.name: Product
field.comment: Used to qualify which security types are returned

field.name: SecurityType
field.comment: Used to qualify which security type is returned

field.name: SecuritySubType
field.comment: Used to qualify which security types are returned

descr.p: TheSecurity Type Requestmessage is used to return a list of security types available from a counterparty or market,
The request can include a specificTradingSessionIDfor whichSecurity Typesshould be returned.

field.name: SecurityResponseID
field.comment: Identifier for the security response message

field.name: SecurityResponseType
field.comment: The result of the security request identified by SecurityReqID

field.name: TotNoSecurityTypes
field.comment: Indicates total number of security types in the event that multiple Security Type messages are used to return results

field.name: LastFragment
field.comment: Indicates whether this is the last fragment in a sequence of message fragments. Only required where message has been fragmented.

field.name: SecurityType
field.comment: Required ifNoSecurityTypes> 0

field.name: Text
field.comment: Comment, instructions, or other identifying information.

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set ifEncodedTextfield is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of theTextfield in the encoded format specified via theMessageEncodingfield.

field.comment: Optional MarketID to specify a particular trading session for which you want to obtain a list of securities that are tradeable.

field.name: MarketSegmentID
field.comment: Optional Market Segment Identifier to specify a particular trading session for which you want to obtain a list of securities that are tradeable.

field.name: TradingSessionID
field.comment: Optional Trading Session Identifier to specify a particular trading session for which you want to obtain a list of securities that are tradeable.

field.name: SubscriptionRequestType
field.comment: Subscribe or unsubscribe for security status to security specified in request.

descr.p: The Security Type message is used to return a list of security types available from a counterparty or market.

field.name: SecurityListRequestType
field.comment: Type ofSecurity List Requestbeing made

field.name: MarketID
field.comment: Identifies the market which lists and trades the instrument.

field.name: MarketSegmentID
field.comment: Identifies the segment of the market to which the specify trading rules and listing rules apply. The segment may indicate the venue, whether retail or wholesale, or even segregation by nationality.

field.comment: Number of underlyings

block.comment: Must be provided if Number of underlyings > 0

field.name: NoLegs
field.comment: Number of legs. Identifies a Multi-leg Execution if present and non-zero.

block.comment: Must be provided if Number of legs > 0

field.name: Text
field.comment: Comment, instructions, or other identifying information.

field.comment: Optional Trading Session Identifier to specify a particular trading session for which you want to obtain a list of securities that are tradeable.

descr.p: TheSecurity List Requestmessage is used to return a list of securities from the counterparty that match criteria provided on the request
Subscription for security status can be optionally specified by including the SubscriptionRequestType[263] field on the message.
SecurityListRequestTypespecifies the criteria of the request:

field.name: SecurityResponseID
field.comment: Identifier for theSecurity Listmessage

field.name: SecurityRequestResult
field.comment: Result of the Security Request identified by the SecurityReqID

field.name: TotNoRelatedSym
field.comment: Used to indicate the total number of securities being returned for this request. Used in the event that message fragmentation is required.

field.name: MarketID
field.comment: Identifies the market which lists and trades the instrument.

field.name: MarketSegmentID
field.comment: Identifies the segment of the market to which the specify trading rules and listing rules apply. The segment may indicate the venue, whether retail or wholesale, or even segregation by nationality.

field.name: LastFragment
field.comment: Indicates whether this is the last fragment in a sequence of message fragments. Only required where message has been fragmented.

field.name: NoRelatedSym
field.comment: Specifies the number of repeating symbols (instruments) specified

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Instrument" fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages" of the requested Security
Insert here the set of "InstrumentExtension" fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".
Insert here the set of "FinancingDetails" fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".
Used to provide listing rules.

field.name: NoStrikeRules
field.comment: Number of strike rule entries. This block specifies the rules for determining how new strikes should be listed within the stated price range of the underlying instrument.

field.name: StrikeRuleID
field.comment: Allows strike rule to be referenced via an identifier so that rules do not need to be explicitly enumerated.

field.name: StartStrikePxRange
field.comment: Starting price for the range to which the StrikeIncrement applies. Price refers to the price of the underlying.

field.name: EndStrikePxRange
field.comment: Ending price of the range to which the StrikeIncrement applies. Price refers to the price of the underlying.

field.name: StrikeIncrement
field.comment: Value by which strike price should be incremented within the specified price.

field.name: StrikeExerciseStyle
field.comment: Enumeration that represents the exercise style for a class of options. Same values as ExerciseStyle.

field.name: NoMaturityRules
field.comment: Number of maturity rule entries. This block specifies the rules for determining how new strikes should be listed within the stated price range of the underlying instrument.

field.name: MaturityRuleID
field.comment: Allows maturity rule to be referenced via an identifier so that rules do not need to be explicitly enumerated.

field.name: MaturityMonthYearFormat
field.comment: Format used to generate the MMY for each option contract.

field.name: MaturityMonthYearIncrementUnits
field.comment: Enumeration specifying the increment unit.

field.name: StartMaturityMonthYear
field.comment: Starting maturity for the range to which the StrikeIncrement applies. Price refers to the price of the underlying.

field.name: EndMaturityMonthYear
field.comment: Ending maturity monthy year to which the StrikeIncrement applies. Price refers to the price of the underlying.

field.name: MaturityMonthYearIncrement
field.comment: Value by which maturity month year should be incremented within the specified price range.

field.name: NoUnderlyings
field.comment: Number of underlyings

block.comment: Must be provided if Number of underlyings > 0
Insert here the set of "Stipulations" fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".

field.name: NoLegs
field.comment: Number of legs that make up the Security

block.comment: Insert here the set of "Instrument Legs" fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages". Required ifNoLegs> 0
Insert here the set of "LegStipulations" fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages". Required ifNoLegs> 0

Insert here the set of "YieldData" fields defined in "Common Components of Application Messages".

field.name: Text
field.comment: Comment, instructions, or other identifying information.

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set ifEncodedTextfield is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of theTextfield in the encoded format specified via theMessageEncodingfield.

descr.p: TheSecurity Listmessage is used to return a list of securities that matches the criteria specified in aSecurity ListRequest.

field.name: MarketID
field.comment: Identifies the market which lists and trades the instrument.

field.name: MarketSegmentID
field.comment: Identifies the segment of the market to which the specify trading rules and listing rules apply. The segment may indicate the venue, whether retail or wholesale, or even segregation by nationality.

block.comment: Specifies the underlying instrument

field.name: DerivativeSymbol
field.comment: Common, "human understood" representation of the security. SecurityID value can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles). Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

field.name: DerivativeSymbolSfx
field.comment: Used in Fixed Income with a value of "WI" to indicate "When Issued" for a security to be reissued under an old CUSIP or ISIN or with a value of "CD" to indicate a EUCP with lump-sum interest rather than discount price.

field.name: DerivativeSecurityID
field.comment: Takes precedence in identifying security to counterparty over SecurityAltID block. Requires DerivativeSecurityIDSource if specified.

field.name: DerivativeSecurityIDSource
field.comment: Required if DerivativeSecurityID is specified.

field.name: DerivativeProduct
field.comment: Indicates the type of product the security is associated with (high-level category).

field.name: DerivativeProductComplex
field.comment: Identifies an entire suite of products for a given market. In Futures this may be "interest rates", "agricultural", "equity indexes", etc.

field.name: DerivFlexProductEligibilityIndicator
field.comment: Used to indicate if a product or group of product supports the creation of flexible securities.

field.name: DerivativeSecurityGroup
field.comment: An exchange specific name assigned to a group of related securities which may be concurrently affected by market events and actions..

field.name: DerivativeCFICode
field.comment: Indicates the type of security using ISO 10962 standard, Classification of Financial Instruments (CFI code) values. It is recommended that DerivativeCFICode be used instead of DerivativeSecurityType for non-Fixed Income instruments.

field.name: DerivativeSecurityType
field.comment: It is recommended that DerivativeCFICode be used instead of SecurityType for non-Fixed Income instruments. Required for Fixed Income. Refer to Volume 7 - Fixed Income Futures and Options should be specified using the CFICode[461] field instead of DerivativeSecurityType (Refer to Volume 7 - Recommendations and Guidelines for Futures and Options Markets.)

field.name: DerivativeSecuritySubType
field.comment: Sub-type qualification/identification of the SecurityType (e.g. for SecurityType=MLEG). If specified, DerivativeSecurityType is required.

field.name: DerivativeMaturityMonthYear
field.comment: Specifies the month and year of maturity. Applicable for standardized derivatives which are typically only referenced by month and year (e.g. S and P futures). Note MaturityDate (a full date) can also be specified.

field.name: DerivativeMaturityDate
field.comment: Specifies date of maturity (a full date). Note that standardized derivatives which are typically only referenced by month and year (e.g. S and P futures). May use MaturityMonthYear and or this field. When using MaturityMonthYear, it is recommended that markets and sell sides report the MaturityDate on all outbound messages as a means of data enrichment.

field.name: DerivativeSettleOnOpenFlag
field.comment: Indicator to determine if Instrument is Settle on Open.

field.name: DerivativeSecurityStatus
field.comment: Gives the current state of the instrument.

field.name: DerivativeIssueDate
field.comment: Date instrument was issued. For Fixed Income IOIs for new issues, specifies the issue date.

field.name: DerivativeInstrRegistry
field.comment: The location at which records of ownership are maintained for this instrument, and at which ownership changes must be recorded. Can be used in conjunction with ISIN to address ISIN uniqueness issues.

field.name: DerivativeCountryOfIssue
field.comment: ISO Country code of instrument issue (e.g. the country portion typically used in ISIN). Can be used in conjunction with non-ISIN SecurityID (e.g. CUSIP for Municipal Bonds without ISIN) to provide uniqueness.

field.name: DerivativeStateOrProvinceOfIssue
field.comment: A two-character state or province abbreviation.

field.name: DerivativeLocaleOfIssue
field.comment: The three-character IATA code for a locale (e.g. airport code for Municipal Bonds).

field.name: DerivativeStrikePrice
field.comment: Used for derivatives, such as options and covered warrants.

field.name: DerivativeStrikeCurrency
field.comment: Used for derivatives.

field.name: DerivativeStrikeMultiplier
field.comment: Used for derivatives. Multiplier applied to the strike price for the purpose of calculating the settlement value.

field.name: DerivativeStrikeValue
field.comment: Used for derivatives. The number of shares/units for the financial instrument involved in the option trade.

field.name: DerivativeOptAttribute
field.comment: Used for derivatives, such as options and covered warrants to indicate a versioning of the contract when required due to corporate actions to the underlying. Should not be used to indicate type of option - use the CFICode[461] for this purpose.

field.name: DerivativeContractMultiplier
field.comment: For Fixed Income, Convertible Bonds, Derivatives, etc. Note: If used, quantities should be expressed in the "nominal" (e.g. contracts vs. shares) amount.

field.name: DerivativeMinPriceIncrement
field.comment: Minimum price increment for the instrument. Could also be used to represent tick value.

field.name: DerivativeMinPriceIncrementAmount
field.comment: Minimum price increment amount associated with the MinPriceIncrement [969]. For listed derivatives, the value can be calculated by multiplying MinPriceIncrement by ContractValueFactor [231]

field.name: DerivativeSettlMethod
field.comment: Settlement method for a contract. Can be used as an alternative to CFI Code value.

field.name: DerivativePriceQuoteMethod
field.comment: Method for price quotation.

field.name: DerivativeFuturesValuationMethod
field.comment: For futures, indicates type of valuation method applied.

field.name: DerivativeListMethod
field.comment: Indicates whether strikes are pre-listed only or can also be defined via user request.

field.name: DerivativeCapPrice
field.comment: Used to express the ceiling price of a capped call.

field.name: DerivativeFloorPrice
field.comment: Used to express the floor price of a capped put.

field.name: DerivativeExerciseStyle
field.comment: Type of exercise of a derivatives security.

field.name: DerivativeOptPayAmount
field.comment: Cash amount indicating the pay out associated with an option. For binary options this is a fixed amount.

field.name: DerivativeTimeUnit
field.comment: Used to indicate a time unit for the contract (e.g., days, weeks, months, etc.).

field.name: DerivativeSecurityExchange
field.comment: Can be used to identify the security.

field.name: DerivativePositionLimit
field.comment: Position Limit for the instrument.

field.name: DerivativeNTPositionLimit
field.comment: Near-term Position Limit for the instrument.

field.name: DerivativeEncodedIssuerLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedIssuer field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: DerivativeEncodedIssuer
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the Issuer field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field.

field.name: DerivativeEncodedSecurityDescLen
field.comment: Must be set if EncodedSecurityDesc field is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: DerivativeEncodedSecurityDesc
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of the SecurityDesc field in the encoded format specified via the MessageEncoding field.

block.comment: Embedded XML document describing security.

field.name: DerivativeContractSettlMonth
field.comment: Must be present for MBS or TBA.

field.name: DerivativeEventType
field.comment: Indicates type of event describing security.

field.name: DerivativeEventTime
field.comment: Specific time of event. To be used in combination with DerivativeEventDateEventDate [1288]

field.name: NoDerivativeInstrumentParties
field.comment: Should contain unique combinations of DerivativeInstrumentPartyID, DerivativeInstrumentPartyIDSource, and DerivativeInstrumentPartyRole

field.name: DerivativeInstrumentPartyID
field.comment: Used to identify party id related to instrument series.

field.name: DerivativeInstrumentPartyIDSource
field.comment: Used to identify source of instrument series party id.

field.name: DerivativeInstrumentPartyRole
field.comment: Used to identify the role of instrument series party id.

field.name: Text
field.comment: Comment, instructions, or other identifying information.

field.name: EncodedTextLen
field.comment: Must be set ifEncodedTextfield is specified and must immediately precede it.

field.name: EncodedText
field.comment: Encoded (non-ASCII characters) representation of theTextfield in the encoded format specified via theMessageEncodingfield.

field.name: TradingSessionID
field.comment: Optional Trading Session Identifier to specify a particular trading session for which you want to obtain a list of securities that are tradeable.

field.name: SubscriptionRequestType
field.comment: Subscribe or unsubscribe for security status to security specified in request.

descr.p: The DerivativeSecurity List Requestmessage is used to return a list of securities from the counterparty that match criteria provided on the request
Subscription for security status can be optionally specified by including the SubscriptionRequestType[263] field on the message.
SecurityListRequestTypespecifies the criteria of the request:
